alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Lexington; Newberry; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 9:17PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Fairfield, Lexington, Newberry and Richland. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 917 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Irmo, Newberry, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Prosperity, Dreher Island State Park, Jenkinsville, Newberry College, Newberry County Airport, Ballentine, Chapin, Little Mountain, Pomaria, Peak, Mid-Carolina High School, Fairview Fire Station, Melvin Park, US-176 and SC-34 Crossroads, Rocky Point Recreation Area and Stoney Hill. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 65 and 102. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown.
